snippet: A mutation to a gene, TREM2, is suspected of interfering with the brain’s ability to prevent the buildup of toxic shards of a protein that accumulate in plaques on the brain.
abstract: Two groups of Alzheimer's disease researchers publish papers in The New England Journal of Medicine highlighting discovery of mutated gene TREM2, which they suspect may interfere with brain’s ability to prevent buildup of plaque; finding provides clues to how and why disease progresses in some elderly patients and not others.
lead_paragraph: A mutation to a gene, TREM2, is suspected of interfering with the brain’s ability to prevent the buildup of toxic shards of a protein that accumulate in plaques on the brain.

headline.main: Alzheimer’s Tied to Mutation Harming Immune Response
headline.print_headline: Two Studies Link Gene Mutation to Alzheimer’s
